data.title: NS 8771 South local symbol V94, Linville, Virginia
data.meta_description: I went to Harrisonburg to check out the cluster of NS branch lines based there.  Turns out this was once the Chesapeake Western Railway that N&W took over in 1954.  The company has continued to survive as a separate operational unit and a subsidiary of the Norfolk Southern.  I even heard a voice on the radio identify themselves as the "CW Dispatcher".  Although I think they are more like a trainmaster/agent type as track authority was issued by the NS Shenandoah DS.  Power is run of the mill NS junk with plenty of catfish.  However this standard cab Dash-9 was a nice find on the job that ran north to Broadway.  This track here is actually part of the former Southern Railway "Manassas to Harrisonburg " branch line and runs through a nice valley with plenty of red clay soil and bluestone rock outcroppings.
data.text: I went to Harrisonburg to check out the cluster of NS branch lines based there. Turns out this was once the Chesapeake Western Railway that N&W took over in 1954. The company has continued to survive as a separate operational unit and a subsidiary of the Norfolk Southern. I even heard a voice on the radio identify themselves as the "CW Dispatcher". Although I think they are more like a trainmaster/agent type as track authority was issued by the NS Shenandoah DS. Power is run of the mill NS junk with plenty of catfish. However this standard cab Dash-9 was a nice find on the job that ran north to Broadway. This track here is actually part of the former Southern Railway "Manassas to Harrisonburg " branch line and runs through a nice valley with plenty of red clay soil and bluestone rock outcroppings.
